revised_title: An Engine for Removing Damps and Foul Air in Mines
tldr: The author presents an engine designed by Reverend J.T. Desaguliers to remove damps and foul air from mines. The engine consists of a triple crank working three pumps that can both suck and force air, making it suitable for various air conditions in mines. The device can improve mine safety by providing fresh air to workers and preventing the extinction of candles used for lighting.
